title: Steeley
author: Steeley
content: Bitcoin.com just put this article up. If the Author, Jamie Redman, is a forum member then shout out to you on a great job writing something that is interesting. Most Physical Bitcoin pieces just ask, "What is a physical Bitcoin?" This article has some updates on Casascius stats. Check it out. https://news.bitcoin.com/casascius-bitcoin-peels-10m-cashed-in-2023-yet-a-1-billion-stash-remains-unclaimed/

comments.author: CoinageMint
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on September 06, 2023, 03:34:06 AMBitcoin.com just put this article up. If the Author, Jamie Redman, is a forum member then shout out to you on a great job writing something that is interesting. Most Physical Bitcoin pieces just ask, "What is a physical Bitcoin?" This article has some updates on Casascius stats. Check it out. https://news.bitcoin.com/casascius-bitcoin-peels-10m-cashed-in-2023-yet-a-1-billion-stash-remains-unclaimed/Not sure if he is a member here, but I shared the article with him

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Thanks for sharing this article Steely...hope more to come with other mags and or websites!

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Thats a very interesting articleThere isnt any other Bitcoin collectible by brand holding as much Bitcoin as Casascius coinshold collectively I guess. It might only be less than 0.02% its still a staggering amount tobe loaded onto metal coins all the same.Quoteof the six S1-COIN-1,000s, each carrying 1,000 BTC, four remain untouched.Wow those 4 coins are in a very elite club! the one who holds out the longest will commandthe most rewarding value.
